name: Kritarth Dandapat
summary: I am a full-stack developer with a recent focus on AI, driven by a deep passion for problem-solving across various fields.  My strong foundation in mathematics, showcased by my success in numerous competitions, fuels my analytical thinking and technical expertise in software development.  I chose Computer Science because I love tackling complex challenges and innovating in both technology and AI.

education.institution: University at Buffalo, the State University of New York (SUNY)

experience.title: Research Assistant
details: Developing models to provide accurate measurements for Orthodontic scoring using depth sensors.
Developing AI-driven models for a dental health application, enhancing diagnostic accuracy and user engagement.
Implementing features to visualize dental health progress and provide personalized recommendations.
Building mobile and web applications using React Native and React in collaboration with Professor Xu.

experience.title: Tutor & Peer-Assisted Leader
experience.organization: Tutoring & Academic Support Services, University at Buffalo
details: Conducting two interactive 1-hour sessions per week, improving students' understanding of Statistics by 30% based on quiz performance and feedback.
Providing in-depth explanations, answering student queries, and reinforcing key concepts during PAL sessions.

experience.title: Founder & Vice President (NSDC)
details: Led the development and launch of the NSDC website, improving event coordination and communication.
Organized and facilitated teamwork for website co-development, ensuring effective planning and execution of events.

notable_projects.name: People Counting using CSRNet
details: Developed a deep learning-based system for accurate people counting in dense crowd scenarios.
Implemented the CSRNet architecture to handle occlusions and improve detection robustness.
Achieved high accuracy and scalability for real-world applications in smart cities, retail analytics, security, and event management.

notable_projects.name: Human Emotion Detection using Vision Transformers and CNN
details: Engineered an emotion detection system leveraging CNN, ResNet-34, and Vision Transformer (ViT) to classify human emotions from images.
Achieved 87.5% accuracy, showcasing the effectiveness of hybrid deep learning architectures.

notable_projects.name: Pathfinding Visualizer using A* Algorithm
details: Developed an interactive pathfinding visualizer in Python using Pygame, implementing the A* search algorithm for real-time visualization.
Created a customizable grid-based interface to enhance user interaction and learning experience.
Demonstrated expertise in algorithmic problem-solving, GUI design, and Python-based application development.

notable_projects.name: Personalized Student Shell (PSS)
details: Designed a command-line shell to enhance student workflow, task management, and learning efficiency.
Integrated features such as custom aliases, command history, auto-completion, code execution, tutorials, error suggestions, and API integrations.
Added gamification elements like command challenges and leaderboards to promote continuous learning.

notable_projects.name: UB Hacking Classifier Web App
details: Co-developed Classifier Web App (https://ubclassifier.web.app/) during a hackathon, focusing on backend and database architecture.
Contributed to building a responsive front-end using ReactJS, MUI, and CSS, ensuring a seamless user experience.

honors_and_awards: Qualified for Top 100 in the World, Northeastern Cybersecurity C2C Finals, 2025
Qualified as One of the Top Two Teams Representing UB, Collegiate Lockdown Cybersecurity Competition (Placed 4th in the Finals), 2025
Dean's List, University at Buffalo (Fall 2023, Spring 2024 & Fall 2024)
Secured All India Rank 761, Manipal Entrance Test 2023
